definition: to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: I usually will ask your helpful, neither overbearing nor servile, likes and dislikes clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我在平时就要求自己乐于助人，不卑不亢，爱憎分明。

definition: to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
to hate evil as one hates an enemy (idiom)
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
daring to act and courageous enough to take responsibility for it/a true man has the courage to accept the consequences of his actions/the buck stops here
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
open and candid (idiom); straightforward and upright
